description.narrative: The objective of the restructured project is to develop and apply management and learning tools for use by government andcommunities to improve efficiency and accountability of the Cameroon education sector.

condition.narrative: The Recipient has employed the independent auditors referred to in Schedule 2 of the Legal Agreement, in accordance with theprovisions of Section ll of Schedule 2 to the Agreement.

The Recipient has established an accounting and financial management system for the Project satisfactory to the Association andadopted a Project Administrative. Financial and Accounting Manual (PAFAM) satisfactory to the Association

title.narrative: Improved efficiency and equity in teacher deployment

comment.narrative: 45% of teachers in the teaching cadre at the primary education level are not deployed according to schooling needs.

MoE states that as a result of addressing the teacher deployment issue through the hiring of contract teachers at primary schoolslevel, the deployment issue is being progressively resolved. However, evidence shows that teacher deployment is still a challengeat48%. The challenges in terms of teacher deployment are more fully discussed in the EFA-FTI Project Implementation CompletionReportdated June 28, 2012.

title.narrative: Percentage of subsidies allocated to private schools in compliance with the criteria laid out in the operations manual

comment.narrative: Operation Manual for the allocation of subsidies developed but not enforced
There is no limited evidence of the percentage of subsidies allocated to private schools in compliance with the criteria laid outin the operations manual.

title.narrative: Regularly updated documentation used to support the development of the sector

comment.narrative: The education sector lacks relevant and up-to-date analytical studies to guide the development of the education sector strategy

Up-to-date documentation is produced and used to inform the strategy, including the following studies: - Analysis of thepost-basiceducation system - Review of the impact of the contract teachers program on the quality of education - Country StatusReport (RESEN)

The work is ongoing and likely to be completed only after project closing. Analytical work under component 1 has been started withthe recruitment of international technical expertise who are collaborating with the National Technical Team. The synthesis study onthe analytical documents in the sector is being completed and will serve asan input for the revision of the education sectorstrategy.

title.narrative: Production of tools that facilitate knowledge exchanges and participation in the international dialogue on education ( CITI and GDLN)

baseline.value: Activities of CITI, CIRD, and GDLN have started but the centers are not operational.

actual.value: The production of tools that facilitate knowledge exchanges and participation in international dialogue on education have not yetbeen instituted due to the delays in the procurement of the GDLN equipment, which have now been received and are being installed.With respect to the CITI, there is insufficient evidence to substantiate the achievement of the target.

title.narrative: Annual publication of statistical yearbook for three levels of education

baseline.value: Delayed production of statistical data, sometimes not accompanied with analytical report

target.value: Annual publication of statistical yearbook for three levels of education

actual.value: The annual statistical yearbooks for the three levels of educatoin are being published regularly.

comment.narrative: There are challenges with the data credibility and validity. The team of international experts in collaboration with the NationalTechnical Team are triangulating the data for verification, cleaning, and reconciliation.

title.narrative: Beneficiary participation in school functioning and school accountability in 86 selected schools in the ZEP

comment.narrative: The activity has now been completed by Plan Cameroon. Note: The number of schools initially envisaged was 86. However, since 29schools were either being already rehabilitated by other development partners, or by the government through the BIP (Budgetd'investissement public), and some of the schools required significant rehabilitation since the technical evaluation revealedgreater than 50% degradation, the IDA project financed the sensitization program and rehabilitation of works in the remaining 57schools which wereassessed to have 50% or less degradation. The 50% threshold was set to ensure that sufficient funds wereavailable to carry out fulland reasonable rehabilitation of the schools.

title.narrative: Number of additional classrooms built or rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project interventions.

comment.narrative: The contract anticipates 419 rehabilitated classrooms. However, there have been some issues with constructionscompanies/enterprises in the Eastern Region. It is therefore likely that the final number of rehabilitated classrooms could be lessthan the target number. The contracts with the community level enterprises for schools renovation were signed in April/May, and therehabilitation is now under completion. The community sensitization work has also been completed.

title.narrative: Number of projects implemented with participation of beneficiary communities in the ZEP

comment.narrative: The contracts with the community level enterprises for schools renovation have been signed. The community sensitization work isscheduled to commence in April 2012.

title.narrative: Production of updated action plans for the education sector strategy

baseline.value: Action plans are updated every three years

target.value: Action plans are updated and validated annually for all 4 sectors

actual.value: The target has not yet been met. It is likely that they will be met only after project closing since the analytical work hascommenced. Action plans will be developed based on the completion of the revised education sector strategy

title.narrative: Institutional audits disseminated to a large audience

baseline.value: Audit realized but report not finalized and results not disseminated

target.value: 5 regional workshops organized to disseminate the results of the audits

actual.value: The audits completed and finalized have not yet been disseminated to a large audience.

comment.narrative: The project secretariat has not yet organized the regional workshops to disseminate the

title.narrative: Preparation of budgets at the primary, secondary and higher levels of the education system based on statistical analysis

baseline.value: Budgets are prepared without accurate and relevant statistical data and analyses.

target.value: Budgets are fully aligned with strategic goals of the sector and based on relevant statistical data.

actual.value: Challenges with respect to the availability of reliable data persist. However, the data verification and cleaning exercise isbeingundertaken, and the revised ESS will be based on the statistical analysis of largely reconciled data. The revised ESS willserve asthe basis for the 2013 budget arbitration at the primary, secondary and higher education levels.

comment.narrative: The development of a methodological guide providing guidelines to better align budget with strategy continues to be work-in-progress.

title.narrative: Institutional audits prepared and evidence of the implementation of recommendations

baseline.value: No evaluation of the implementation of the recommendations

target.value: Action plan for implementing recommendations has been implemented

actual.value: Action plan for implementing recommendations has been finalized but its implementation is not yet assessed.

title.narrative: School health card published for primary and secondary education

target.value: School health card finalized and validated

actual.value: The school health card and the school score cards have been completed and validated for primary and secondary education levels.

comment.narrative: The school health cards and the school report cards were completed in 2011 their dissemination is ongoing.

title.narrative: Biennial update of the ESS based on analytic work conducted during preceding two years

baseline.value: The strategy is updated every 2 years but no reliable statistical data or analytical products are available to inform policy makers.

target.value: The updated strategy is informed by reliable data and relevant analytical work.

actual.value: The revision of the ESS is underway based on analytical work having been launched over the past few months. The revised ESS willinform the 2013 budget cycle.

comment.narrative: The analytical work on the education sector country status report is underway. The data collection is ongoing, and the financialsimulation model is envisaged to be completed by end-September 2012 (after project closing date). The activities linked to thepreparation of the Education Sector strategy and the post-basic education study have also been launched albeit not throughfinancing fromthe project, but through financing from the Global Partnership for Education (GPE). The government is currentlyrevising the ESS onthe basis of analytical studies undertaken during the last few months.

title.narrative: Production of analytical tools (ex: simulation models)

baseline.value: There is a lack of capacity to develop and use simulation models or other budget supporting tool s

target.value: Analytical tools are developed and used for budget preparation in each sub-sector

actual.value: The target has not been met. It is likely that they will be after project closing. The analytical tools are being developed (ex.financing simulation model) and will be used to inform the budget preparation in eachsub-sector during the 2013 budget cycle.

title.narrative: System for learning assessment at the primary level

comment.narrative: A summative evaluation of student achievement/ assessment system after primary education does exist. However, there are no regularformative, qualitative assessments. Further, the early grade reading assessment results undertaken in 2011/12 have not yet beenvalidated by the Ministry of Basic Education.

The schools rehabilitation/ renovation has now been completed, the construction of latrines has commenced, and 33 out of 37 wellshave been dug. 34,883 community members through 1190 meetings in the 4 ZEP regions have benefited from the mobilization andsensitization program.Meanwhile, 113 capacity development activities have been undertaken since the original project wasimplemented, of which 32 capacity development activites/workshops have benefited 1,576 direct beneficiaries since the project wasrestructured in April2010. Further, an estimated 57,302 students in 57 schools will benefit from the schoolsrehabilitation/renovation activity. The target of 75,000 was based on an renovation and community sensitization of an estimated 86schools.
